item.title: The meaning of sanctuary
item.description: Hijacking a house of worship to make a political point will only backfire.

item.title: Jack Smith is in First Amendment denial
item.description: The former special counsel defends an indefensible bid to gag Donald Trump as he ran for president.

item.title: The TikTok divestment deal doesn’t go far enough
item.description: ByteDance will maintain ownership of the app’s coveted algorithm and license it to the spinoff.

item.title: Sending Iran another deterrence message
item.description: The regime kills and tortures protesters despite a White House warning.

item.title: This unlikely leader ended Trump — with gentlemanly clarity
item.description: Donald Trump offered a “golden dome.” Mark Carney provided a grand rebuke.

item.title: I worked for Trump. He has changed.
item.description: Free markets, family legacies and $3 meals, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: How I helped my mom prepare for her death
item.description: Iran, youth sports and family secrets, in readers’ eyes.

item.title: The Harris campaign’s suspicion of Shapiro reveals an ugly truth
item.description: Pennsylvania Gov. Josh Shapiro revealed a disturbing encounter with the Kamala Harris campaign in 2024.

item.title: Javier Milei brings Davos back to earth
item.description: The Argentine president’s defense of free markets was timely and needed.

item.title: With executive power rampant, the right book has arrived
item.description: Decades ago, a Supreme Court justice explained how to think today about Trump’s power grabs.

item.title: A nightmare scenario for Iran
item.description: Ethnic divisions make any post-Islamic Republic order deeply uncertain.

item.title: ‘He treats us with contempt’: This is not leadership
item.description: America’s allies may comply for now. But the damage to trust will have consequences.

item.title: There’s a way to stop Trump. First, drop the fascism debate.
item.description: Better ideas are more important than dire warnings about Trump as dictator.

item.title: Improve the IRS by giving it less to do
item.description: A simpler tax code would be easier to understand and enforce.

item.title: A toxic tonic
item.description: Michael Ramirez cartoon on the snake oil of Republicans and big government.

item.title: Democrats finally abandon Bill Clinton
item.description: A bipartisan House committee held Bill and Hillary Clinton in contempt of Congress. Amazing.

item.title: What to ask yourself if you think you may be drinking too much
item.description: Responding to reader questions about the risks of alcohol use.

item.title: Europe has stopped pretending
item.description: Trump’s wrecking ball creates new determination to address the continent’s long-festering problems.

item.title: DHS: No judicial warrant? No problem.
item.description: Any legal novice could point out the problem with the Trump administration’s view on warrants.

item.title: Plato’s fall to culture wars carries a troubling irony
item.description: ‘Members Only: Palm Beach,’ free speech, university board independence and whale protections, in readers’ eyes.
